Literature Review: The electrochemical manufacturing of organic chemical commodities offers a promising alternative to traditional thermochemical processes, enabling the direct use of renewable electricity to reduce greenhouse gas emissions from the chemical industry. This review discusses various electrochemical synthesis approaches for the production of light olefins, olefin oxidation derivatives, aromatics, and methanol, considering reaction thermodynamics, available feedstocks, and competing thermochemical processes. We also summarize successful catalysis and reaction engineering strategies to overcome technological challenges and provide an outlook on strategies for large-scale electrochemical manufacturing.
